header.topics: The weather, sickness, returning ‘home’ (for a funeral), favourite types of job, sense of belonging/home, looking at social media images, being sick, therapy, television, holiday plans/where to live plans.
header.activity: Two friends talking about various topics (see 9 above) in the flat of one friend, in Tarnow, Poland.

speaker.occupation: unemployed/ Some part-time private TEFL teacher/ Semi-retired
Teacher of English as a foreign Language

I was sat hello hello
there we are
erm no I was sat on the balcony on Tuesday for hours reading and drinking tea
very good
I just needed the sun
yeah
and it was so nice and I thought I can't believe it feels like spring
mm
and then today it's like no
I know
and I checked the weather again and it's like up and down up and down and then snow scheduled next Friday as well
yeah but it's funny though cos it'll say snow and then the day will roll round and it'll be rain

but last night's snow was forecast but I just couldn't believe it when it actually appeared
no I know
it's just so weird going from fourteen degrees to I think there was probably three or four inches last night
yeah and it's not it wasn't even that cold I don't think I didn't think it was below zero

yeah mm random I'm just really I just need some sun now

just for mm mm

so

okay
it's really not a lot erm cos I just feel so no I know like erm in no way should I feel guilty
no god no you're sick

cos I'd drank like a bottle of gin straight
oh that'll do it oh

er and then had to my I couldn't even speak my friend had to phone it was when I worked at a clothes shop at uni my friend had to go she just can't come in today cos she's just broken her nose and she's got two black eyes and her face is full of cuts
so she'll be off for about a week
and I thought I've never taken time off apart from that er and you know I just feel a bit of a wuss like it's er it's only a cold
I'd say it speaks more of a lack of self-love
do you think?
not wishing to pass on any judgement bu
no go on
but yeah cos I feel if you love yourself and respect yourself sufficiently then you really want to take good care of the physical human organism your consciousness occupies for a short period of time
mm mm mm mm mm mm mm mm
and you take care of it and you nurture it and if it's not functioning right you give it what it needs until it does which is usually rest
yeah yeah true I'm not a very resty person
and I think that's why the no I know
I think that's the problem
or even just rest sounds like being horizontal and not doing anything

but it could be just watching Netflix sending emails

fiddling about on Facebook whatever sitting on the balcony reading a book when it's not full of snow
mm mm mm mm
yeah
yeah I know but I think it's just tricky I find it really hard
so I suppose we come from a culture where there's a lot of guilt associated with time off
yeah
and there's this perception that you need to martyr yourself to every role and
and here I think it's completely different
yeah

if you're sick you don't go to work and in England I you know I was sort of talking about this on Twitter the other day like if you're in an office people you know say stuff if you you're off work because you've got a cold or whatever
mm
but then if you're in work and you've got a cold people are like oh god this person's sniffing the whole time
yeah
so you can't win
you can't win so you might as well do what gives you your greatest joy
whatever you want yeah yeah
yeah
but I I ju I feel guilty in the sense that other people are going to have to cover my lessons or they're all being cancelled and all of this stuff so it's just a bit shit
mm yeah I suppose I can understand that if other people need to do more

but then people get sick so the organisation really expects that that's gonna happen
yeah yeah and I've covered lessons for loads of people so
yeah

mm mm yeah
yeah

yeah and it was winter break and they had were underpaid so
and then ta da yeah so now some extra hours
yeah true
they'd probably be full of gratitude hooray 's sick hooray
hooray oh thank you thank you

no I think it'll be fine and by Monday hopefully I'll be right as rain I'm just really pissed off because I was doing everything right I was like
describe right
well I was eating right drinking right going to the gym being like sort of really positive
mm
and like we talked about this loads I was like in a really good frame of mind and I'm just so annoyed that I feel like I've been set back

you know and it'll take some time to get back to that point

mm
and this just might be everything just coming out now
yeah
cos it's gotta have it's release at some point so if you've been doing all of the stuff that helps your body

and helps your mind and helps you know every aspect of you then it's it's just I don't know I do see it as that purging process it's that getting it all out
mm mm mm mm yeah part of the recovery
and with lungs you know you'll be coughing it all up that's quite literal really of getting out that which is within and no longer serves you

tell you tales well since I saw you last erm on Thursday

and whose funeral it was on the Friday
oh okay

and I presumed all my friends in nern ern as I want to call it Northern Ireland
mm mm
would be with their families and would be having work parties
mm mm yeah

and be a little bit busy erm so I haven't seen them from half a year really and I was delighted to see everybody again and people are just so friendly so welcoming so kind and I'd kind of forgotten that
mm mm
and so smiley as well I miss that smileyness of Northern Ireland so yeah so that was Thursday night and then on Friday it was the funeral which was really lovely

and 's dad was a a farmer in good Protestant Northern Ireland
mm mm
er so it was a Presbyterian church erm funeral and it was only July that her mum died so she's lost both within erm six seven months so
yeah really soon mm mm

yeah but I was so glad to be there to sort of offer my support to erm and to see the family as well they're a lovely lovely family and the service was nice and a few people gave their eulogies and erm his grandson so 's son is quite religious and he did a reading erm and then there was tea and sandwiches and cakes
mm nice
and a a big feast and then some people went off to the grave ordinarily the grave comes first
mm mm

and the feast comes afterwards but they decided to do it the other way around cos the weather was so shit and people had travelled from far and wide and were heading back again so yeah then they went off to the graveyard and the mud and the torrential rain
right mm mm mm mm oh no
jeez it rained I'd forgotten I'd forgotten about the wind and the rain and I've come to realise that when it's cold here like today said it's two degrees
mm mm
and I feel really warm and I know I've got the clothes for it in Northern Ireland it's sort of six seven degree but fuck I was cold
yeah it feels colder
oh my god I shivered my way around there and houses are colder so every night I was wearing socks and er thick trousers a fleece
mm mm yeah yeah yeah yeah
just just freezing so even though technically on paper it's warmer with the icy winds and the cold houses
mm mm mm mm

it's just so cold so that was a bit of a wake up call reminder erm oh yeah and on Friday night went to the theatre erm there's a lovely little theatre in it's not been er it's renovated and reopened a few years ago called the it's quite small and saw Educating Rita
nice

what people you knew or just people saying hello?
yeah well random people I used to work in the off licence there for a few months
right

yeah
and it's like everybody is so smiley hi how are you? you know little comment on the weather
mm mm mm mm
really ah I just thought oh god it feels like home and it does and it I kind of realised while I was there it really does feel like home there more so than England

no and it's not to make money it was just
it's just yeah it's social

and you end up knowing people's life stories and things like that and yeah
yeah

that was a lovely little job and I took that that was erm after had died and erm I was kind of thinking er right I really ought should ought must get back to work and this job came up you know just minimum wage twenty hours a week and I thought yeah I can do that and it was really to get me out of the house and be social again
mm mm mm mm

but I came to realise I absolutely bloody love it so for all of my intellectual capabilities and all of the business roles that I've performed in the you know business suit high powered nonsense I've been through
mm mm
I think fuck it actually I really enjoy retail work in a small community environment
mm mm

where there's no stress and very little sales pressure or sales pressure you can ignore quite successfully erm and I really enjoy physical work I love being on my feet all day I love moving my body I love the manual aspect of that job

and I love bringing order to chaos

you know order comes in put it away shop looks lovely clean tidy beautiful something so satisfying about that

yeah yeah I you know I really liked my job when I was doing that there were times when I'd be like oh god I I'd just be like doing really really menial tasks and I'd be like why am I doing this? er but I went home every night no stress

you know it's just like a man who buys like a packet of cigarettes and two cans of Red Bull or something
